reviewText: Team Fortress 2 - The most fun you can have online" (quote by PC Gamer)\n\nThen we got Party Jousting
date: which can be described as The most fun you can have offline
recommended:
playing with your friends.

Party Jousting is a local multiplayer game where you control pets and battle your friends to death.

Requirements:
-Low PC.
-Keyboard with at least two working buttons (Also
hoursPlayed: 'Enter' and 'Escape' are ++)\n-A free to play Steam account.\n-A Friend (you need to own at least one. It is too bad that nowdays you can't buy one legally
voteText:
because most Steam user doesn't have friends)

Graphic:
Pixel Art graphic with high-polished pixelated pigs and ducks.

Gameplay:
You can control a pet
votesTotal:
collect coins... all with only one button.

Storyline:
You are a little pig named "Bacon". Evil developer named Fabian Viking trapped you in a cage with a duck
votesFunny: a sheep and a flying fish. He forces you all to battle to death and only one of you who kill others will be released and free. But
commentsCount: the evil psychopath Fabian also put obstacles that can kill you once you make a collosion with them. Also
column16: he is helping some of the pets by giving them laser guns and koppa troppa shells from Mario Cart."
column20: 56 of 60 people (93%) found this review helpful 51 people found this review funny

reviewText:
It's like Flappy Bird and Joust (Atari/Arcade) had a meth baby.

I played this on xbox live arcade a few years ago, this version seems to work pretty much the same. Touch the floor, walls, or ceiling- or get bopped on the head by another player -- and you lose a heart. Lose all your hearts and you're out. We tested it with up to 7 players and it gets very, very hard the more players you add. Well, not exactly hard- just freakin insane.

Simple manic fun, and for free. There's some DLC but it seems reasonably priced (I guess) and I don't really think it's necessary to have some fun with this. This isn't the greatest game, but don't write it off as a generic Flappy Bird clone.

reviewText:
Have you ever decided, after logging in, that you honestly dont really feal like applying yourself to anything cranial WHATSOVER nor do you intend on expending any effort or have any inspiration to do anything further from randomly stabbing one, (1), singular key in the vain hope it will do something productive or possibly entertain you beyond your wildest fantasies?

Yes?

I have the game for you.

Party Jousting, creating as a fun little project and released initially on the pornographically named yet unfortunately not inclined, XBOX, has arrived on the Steam platform. This homage to the original coin op JOUST side view multiplay possibly first ever true PvP (platform?) game is a wonderfully addictive bit of clever that will absorb you for those 5-10 minutes you dont really have the energy nor inclination for anything else.

One of those brain absorbing-login-and-not-really-wanna-do-much-but-wanna-do-someinthg games that has some clever depth and capacity to be used as a quickie or a new addiction to skill growth.

Mad hilarious multi-player action that you simply have to try to believe its fun meter. Download it now!!!

reviewText:
When Flappy Bird meets multiplayer.

When you realise you can control multiple characters at once.

When you make your Left side brain vs your Right side brain.

When you master using 4 characters in one session and not let any of them die for 30 seconds.

When you try to find out which is your dominant finger.

When you have alot of friends over at your house, but only one pc.

When you realise your fingers are your only friends.

You have no friends.

10/10 best singleplayer game. Would be even more fun if I had real friends.

reviewText:
This is what Flappy Bird would have looked like if it was permanently fixed on death match with multi-players, the title was simplicity at its best while remaining a blast to play at parties.

The game play consist of two or more players controlling their characters with a single button press, while the duration of your press dictates the height of which you fly. Sounds simple? Well, did I mention that you also have to avoid spike traps, other players, along with the dreaded borders of doom?

It gets more hectic with the more players you have, which is a good thing, especially when you have friends over for a bout. Even if you are the type thatâ€™s forever alone, you can have an awesome battle between your left hand and right hand, in which my right hand always win.

Slight warning though if youâ€™re planning on using a single keyboard. Unless you have a mechanical keyboard with some specialised drivers, it is not likely to register more than four key presses at the same time. So I would recommend a controller or two on the side to even out the players on each input device.

The DLC packs are not required in any way, but they do add more characters and hats, it wonâ€™t hurt to buy some if you happen to like the game and support the developer.

reviewText: Party Jousting is like multiplayer flappy bird, you bounce back and forth each click trying to avoid obstacles or hit power ups, the last player alive wins. Each player has a few hearts so they can be hit more than once. If you get a ton of people playing it gets pretty crazy. Currently there is ONLY local multiplayer, so Party Jousting seems like the odd couch play game on PC. I have to say I like it even if its some of the most simple multiplayer ever.

reviewText: This game is really good! It monetizes very well by DLC you don't have have to buy for a good time, but if you really want to, you can because it's only (at most) $3.23 (Not a paid ad. Why did I say that? Legal reasons). It handles local multiplayer very well despite being a small indie game. I do have one problem with it though. You have to have at least you and one other person, otherwise, you don't have the good time that this game presents. Overall, this is a great game! I'd recommend it to people who are looking to have a good time with a group of friends for free.

reviewText:
3 Of My friends came over.

Character ChoosingFriend1 chose the pink duck,
Friend2 chose the green pig,
Friend3 chose the blue sheep,
I chose the red/cyan fish.

Round 1Friend1 tried to kill everyone by falling on them when they were lying on the floor.
Friend2 knocked him over twice.
I finished him.
Friend3 jumped around trying to avoid everyone and everything.
Friend3 got a laser gun powerup.
Friend3 murdered my fabulous fish.
Friend2 knocked him to his last heart.
Friend2 ran into the ceiling and died.
Friend3 won round 1.

Rounds 2, 3 & 4Friends2&3 ran into the floor and ceiling straightaway.
Friend1 then proceeded to squish them from above.
Friends2&3 both died.
Friend1 hit the ceiling and died.
I won.

Round 5Friends1&2 both ran into spikes.
Me&Friend3 ran into eachother.
Friend2 Squished us.
Friend2 hit the ceiling.
Friend1 wins.

The ScoreboardI barely won.
Friend3 came second by a coin or 2.
Friend1 got third.
Friend2 was last.

11/10 Would Party Joust Again
